Summary: Transport and Elimination of Smoke Purification Residues (rgrr) Entsorgung + Recycling Zürich Abwasser. Description: The service put in the competition includes the transport and the discharge of the smoke purification residues (RGRR) of the KSV Ara Werdhölzli in Zurich. The Step Werdhölzli has a recovery installation of the treatment sludge (KSV) in Which are incinerated the dehydrated purification sludge from all wastewater treatment plants in the canton of Zurich. Each year, it results in around 650 tonnes of smoke gas treatment residues (RGRR) from dry purification of smoke gases, which must be eliminated with respect for the environment. Prepared to be evacuated to the Step of Werdhölzli. The Silo of the KSV, in which the RGRRs are collected, has a capacity of 25 tonnes. RGRRs designate all residues from the purification of KSV smoke gases, in particular electrofilters ash and residues from the purification of more advanced smoke gases. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SBB AG INFRASTRUCTURE, ENVIRONMENT & SUSTAINABILITY. Summary: "round Table" to Improve the Efficiency of the Infrastruktur, Umwelt & Nachhaltigkeit Ballast Ballast.. Description: Derived from the CFF 2030 strategy, CFF Infrastructure has set the objective of ecological sustainability with the four commercial capacities "neutral for the climate", "renewable", "biodiversity" and "capable of circulating". The CFF Infrastructure environment and sustainability unit wishes to lead an open dialogue during a "round table" with specialized experts from the fields of railways, authorities and industry. The emphasis will be placed on the obstacles encountered so far and the future chances of increasingly increasing the efficiency in the field of railway tracks. It will be a question of bringing together new ideas and possibilities for future developments in demand and supply. The attention will be focused on the closure of the ballast circuit within the rail system and the preservation of primary resources (hard rocks) which results from it.. Published Date: 2023-04-19. Closing Date: 2023-06-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: "round Table" to Improve the Efficiency of the Infrastruktur, Umwelt & Nachhaltigkeit Ballast Ballast.
output.Description: Derived from the CFF 2030 strategy, CFF Infrastructure has set the objective of ecological sustainability with the four commercial capacities "neutral for the climate", "renewable", "biodiversity" and "capable of circulating". The CFF Infrastructure environment and sustainability unit wishes to lead an open dialogue during a "round table" with specialized experts from the fields of railways, authorities and industry. The emphasis will be placed on the obstacles encountered so far and the future chances of increasingly increasing the efficiency in the field of railway tracks. It will be a question of bringing together new ideas and possibilities for future developments in demand and supply. The attention will be focused on the closure of the ballast circuit within the rail system and the preservation of primary resources (hard rocks) which results from it.
